introduction: The four-part Heroes Under Ground include "Bringing Fact to Fiction" (12:21), "Preparations for Freedom" (19:50), "The Flight to Freedom" (9:22), and "A Standing Ovation" (5:58).Narrated by Burt Reynolds, we hear from Stalag Luft III ex-POWs John Weir, Alex Cassie, Albert Wallace, and James J. Cullen, wife of ex-POW Betty Floody, authors Jonathan Vance and Arthur Durand, and assistant director Robert Relyea.We learn about the origins of the tale and its path to the screen, adapting the historical tale and characters, the sets and locations, the realities of the actual prison camp and the escape, the elements of the individual flights and liberties taken, the prosecution of those responsible for some of the story’s atrocities, and the film’s reception.
